# Quote PDF

{/* Define attributes and code as variables */}
{(() => {
  const attributes = [
    {
      name: "response",
      type: "string (base64)",
      description: "The response body is a base64-encoded string containing the PDF document. Decode this string using standard base64 decoding to obtain the binary PDF file. The response includes a Content-Type header of 'application/pdf'. The base64 string can be used directly in data URIs for web applications or decoded to save as a file.",
    },
  ];

  // Request attributes for GET /api/v2/quotes/:id/pdf
  const requestAttributes = [
    {
      name: "id",
      type: "integer",
      description: "The unique identifier of the quote to retrieve the PDF for.",
      required: true,
    },
  ];

  // GET request doesn't have a body
  const requestExampleCode = '';

  const exampleCode = ``;

  return (
    <ApiPage
      title="Quote PDF"
      description="This GET endpoint allows you to download the PDF document for a specific client quote. The response body contains a base64-encoded string representing the PDF document. To use the PDF, decode the base64 string to obtain the binary PDF file. The response includes a Content-Type header of 'application/pdf'. You can decode the base64 string using standard base64 decoding libraries in your programming language, or use it directly in data URIs (e.g., 'data:application/pdf;base64,<encoded_string>')."
      method="GET"
      path="/api/v2/quotes/:id/pdf"
      attributes={attributes}
      exampleCode={exampleCode}
      exampleTitle="Example response (base64-encoded PDF string)"
      exampleLang="text"
      contentType="application/pdf"
      formatLabel="TEXT"
      requestAttributes={requestAttributes}
      requestExampleCode={requestExampleCode}
      requestExampleTitle="Example request"
      requestMethod="GET"
      requestPath="/api/v2/quotes/:id/pdf"
    />
  );
})()}
